Comment.Text: You can browse each box' documentation by selecting the box and pressing F1

Then comes the feature extraction part. The signal is filtered in a large alpha/beta [8 30] Hz range. The filtered signal is then splitted in blocks of 1 second every 16th second and the logarithmic band power is computed thanks to the two Simple DSP and the Signal Average boxes. The matrices can then be converted in feature vectors. note: depending on what frequency range reacts best for the subject, you may have to tune this part of the scenario note: whatever change you do on this scenario, don't forget to do the same on the classifier trainer scenario

Overview This scenario can be used online once the CSP spatial filter and the classifier is trained. note: the recorded files go to the folder where the scenario xml is located (${Player_ScenarioDirectory}/).

Finally, the feature vectors are classifier with an LDA classifier. Note that the state vector of the classifier (which in the case of the LDA is the distance to the separation plane) is sent to the Graz Visualization box for feedback ! In order to display correct feedback, the Graz Visualization box expects a negative value for one class and a positive value for the other class.
The CSP spatial filter produced in the previous scenario is used prior to the feature extraction.
Player setting in python scripting box: Set to 0 for single-player Set to 1 for player1 and 2 for player2
